TopicTitle: [0.21.1] Ordan Industries Telescope! Last Updated August 23, 2013!

Articles.Content:
Download: http://www.myordan.com/ksp/download.php?file=OrdanInd_telescope.zip

Ordan Industries is proud to present their latest and greatest telescope!

View anomalies from orbit, see the wonders of Eeloo! See what's stuck in Jeb's nose!

Pictures (all taken from within 100km of Kerbin):

Edited August 23, 2013 by hubbazoot

Very nice, but I have some questions:

1. Without SAS, how are you manuvering it in your pics?

2. There is an option for show/Hide GUI in the context menu while operating. I'm not seeing any Pop-up GUI with this command though. Should I be? I ask because I didn't notice anything in the readme (maybe I missed it?)

A neat mod though, should be fun to play with

Very nice, but I have some questions:

1. Without SAS, how are you manuvering it in your pics?

2. There is an option for show/Hide GUI in the context menu while operating. I'm not seeing any Pop-up GUI with this command though. Should I be? I ask because I didn't notice anything in the readme (maybe I missed it?)

A neat mod though, should be fun to play with

1. It turns, just very slowly. I reduced the sensitivity so you can actually get an object in view and keep it there. You have to keep it in view manually, because the angle adjustments are more precise than SAS.

2. Action groups.

Hi about the mumechlib.dll. I already have it installed and the file looks the same, do I need to overwrite it (did you make any changes to the dll)?

W
in general, use the .dll with the more recent date.

Which is the one already installed. Which is April 18th. The .dll contained in the Orban industries file is dated a day earlier . Now if he hasn't changed the .dll I can use the newer one. If he has changed it I have to use the .dll he put up, breaking another addon which gave me this newer .dll version (not mechjeb from which the .dll ultimately comes btw)

Thx, W

Which is the one already installed. Which is April 18th. The .dll contained in the Orban industries file is dated a day earlier . Now if he hasn't changed the .dll I can use the newer one. If he has changed it I have to use the .dll he put up, breaking another addon which gave me this newer .dll version (not mechjeb from which the .dll ultimately comes btw)

Thx, W

Use the newer one. If it's not already in the readme, I'll make sure it is tonight.

This is awesome. Exactly what I wanted from this game as it develops was more reasons to put up satellites/more to do in space. More SCIENCE!

This is the kind of stuff we need. Thanks.
Wait, Jeb has a nose?

Wait, Jeb has a nose?

It's REALLY small, you have to zoom WAAAAAAAY in.

We must do this for science! Your zoom camera (great part btw) is on Jeb's vehicle, so I've just got to get him to stand in front....

"Stand here Jeb!"

"Jeb?"

...

Jeb is wandering off to climb one of Dres's hills...

Edited April 25, 2013 by Tw1
Does this still bug out the map view? I remember having that problem and I'd rather not restart KSP every time I use the telescope.
It sometimes does make the orbit lines large and fuzzy if you activate the telescope view in map mode. Just don't do that.

Does this still bug out the map view? I remember having that problem and I'd rather not restart KSP every time I use the telescope.

You don't have to restart KSP, just going back to the space center will usually fix the issue.
Is there going to be a fix one day? That's the only drawback of the system.

Is there going to be a fix one day? That's the only drawback of the system.

Maybe. I can't say for sure right now.
whats better this or the zeus telescope? they seem exactly the same

whats better this or the zeus telescope? they seem exactly the same

As a totally objective individual... mine's better.

This pack has two telescopes. One big one, and one small one that is easy to add to other ships. Zeus is only a big telescope.

I like the small one best!
